A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Alright here's some Star Wars thoughts\, without plot spoilers.

It felt like the movie was tackling too many things crammed into one film. 

There's some great action sequences. We get some backstory answers\, but certainly not all of them.

Mark's performance has such demanding gravitas. 

I like the addition of the porg\, don't worry guys this is no Jar-Jar.

My criticism with The Force Awakens is still present\, and continues with The Last Jedi. The Jedi powers are almost too powerful to be believable\, and makes aspect of the script seem like God-modding. We have years of past films\, books and more and folks without training can do so much seemingly out of nowhere? I don't think so. 

Rose's character while a nice addition\, could have had her storyline and escapades with others cut from the majority of the movie for a tighter narrative\, and to improve pacing. 

And there's some moments that irked me\, majorly. But other moments where I cheered\, laughed\, or cried.  :) 

It's worth seeing as major things happen\, but I both love and hate it\, and therefore say make it a matinee. 

What happened to having movie villains that were strong\, menacing\, scary? So powerful as to be nigh impossible to overcome\, so when you get the better of them you can cheer? Kylo is annoying\, can he die already because he has a temper tantrum and inadverteningly nukes himself\, please? To mnany of the baddies in this film are laughable at best.
